verses.text: Now there was a man of Benjamin , whose name \add was\add* Kish , the son of Abiel , the son of Zeror , the son of Bechorath , the son of Aphiah , a Benjamite , a mighty man of power.\f + \fr 9.1 \ft a Benjamite: or, the son of a man of Jemini\f*\f + \fr 9.1 \ft power: or, substance\f*

And he had a son , whose name \add was\add* Saul , a choice young man , and a goodly : and \add there was\add* not among the children of Israel a goodlier person than he: from his shoulders and upward \add he was\add* higher than any of the people. \p
And the asses of Kish Saul’s father were lost. And Kish said to Saul his son , Take now one of the servants with thee, and arise , go seek the asses.

And he passed through mount Ephraim , and passed through the land of Shalisha , but they found \add them\add* not: then they passed through the land of Shalim , and \add there they were\add* not: and he passed through the land of the Benjamites , but they found \add them\add* not.

\add And\add* when they were come to the land of Zuph , Saul said to his servant that \add was\add* with him, Come , and let us return ; lest my father leave \add caring\add* for the asses , and take thought for us.

And he said unto him, Behold now, \add there is\add* in this city a man of God , and \add he is\add* an honourable man ; all that he saith cometh surely to pass : now let us go thither; peradventure he can shew us our way that we should go.

Then said Saul to his servant , But, behold, \add if\add* we go , what shall we bring the man ? for the bread is spent in our vessels , and \add there is\add* not a present to bring to the man of God : what have we?\f + \fr 9.7 \ft is spent…: Heb. is gone out of, etc\f*\f + \fr 9.7 \ft have we: Heb. is with us?\f*

And the servant answered Saul again , and said , Behold, I have here at hand the fourth part of a shekel of silver : \add that\add* will I give to the man of God , to tell us our way.\f + \fr 9.8 \ft I have…: Heb. there is found in my hand\f*
( Beforetime in Israel , when a man went to enquire of God , thus he spake , Come , and let us go to the seer : for \add he that is\add* now \add called\add* a Prophet was beforetime called a Seer.)
Then said Saul to his servant , Well said ; come , let us go. So they went unto the city where the man of God \add was\add*.\f + \fr 9.10 \ft Well said: Heb. Thy word is good\f* \p

¶ \add And\add* as they went up the hill to the city , they found young maidens going out to draw water , and said unto them, Is the seer here?\f + \fr 9.11 \ft the hill…: Heb. in the ascent of the city\f*

And they answered them, and said , He is ; behold, \add he is\add* before you: make haste now, for he came to day to the city ; for \add there is\add* a sacrifice of the people to day in the high place :\f + \fr 9.12 \ft sacrifice: or, feast\f*

As soon as ye be come into the city , ye shall straightway find him, before he go up to the high place to eat : for the people will not eat until he come , because he doth bless the sacrifice ; \add and\add* afterwards they eat that be bidden. Now therefore get you up ; for about this time ye shall find him.\f + \fr 9.13 \ft this time: Heb. to day\f*
And they went up into the city : \add and\add* when they were come into the city , behold, Samuel came out against them, for to go up to the high place. \p
¶ Now the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had told Samuel in his ear a day before Saul came , saying ,\f + \fr 9.15 \ft told…: Heb. revealed the ear of Samuel\f*

To morrow about this time I will send thee a man out of the land of Benjamin , and thou shalt anoint him \add to be\add* captain over my people Israel , that he may save my people out of the hand of the Philistines : for I have looked upon my people , because their cry is come unto me.

And when Samuel saw Saul , the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto him, Behold the man whom I spake to thee of! this same shall reign over my people.\f + \fr 9.17 \ft reign over: Heb. restrain in\f* \p
Then Saul drew near to Samuel in the gate , and said , Tell me, I pray thee, where the seer’s house \add is\add*.

And Samuel answered Saul , and said , I \add am\add* the seer : go up before me unto the high place ; for ye shall eat with me to day , and to morrow I will let thee go , and will tell thee all that \add is\add* in thine heart.

And as for thine asses that were lost three days ago , set not thy mind on them; for they are found. And on whom \add is\add* all the desire of Israel ? \add Is it\add* not on thee, and on all thy father’s house ?\f + \fr 9.20 \ft three…: Heb. to day three days\f*

And Saul answered and said , \add Am\add* not I a Benjamite , of the smallest of the tribes of Israel ? and my family the least of all the families of the tribe of Benjamin ? wherefore then speakest thou so to me?\f + \fr 9.21 \ft so…: Heb. according to this word\f*
And Samuel took Saul and his servant , and brought them into the parlour , and made them sit in the chiefest place among them that were bidden , which \add were\add* about thirty persons.
And Samuel said unto the cook , Bring the portion which I gave thee, of which I said unto thee, Set it by thee.

And the cook took up the shoulder , and \add that\add* which \add was\add* upon it, and set \add it\add* before Saul. And \add Samuel\add* said , Behold that which is left ! set \add it\add* before thee, \add and\add* eat : for unto this time hath it been kept for thee since I said , I have invited the people. So Saul did eat with Samuel that day.\f + \fr 9.24 \ft left: or, reserved\f* \p
¶ And when they were come down from the high place into the city , \add Samuel\add* communed with Saul upon the top of the house.

And they arose early : and it came to pass about the spring of the day , that Samuel called Saul to the top of the house , saying , Up , that I may send thee away. And Saul arose , and they went out both of them, he and Samuel , abroad.

\add And\add* as they were going down to the end of the city , Samuel said to Saul , Bid the servant pass on before us, (and he passed on ,) but stand thou still a while , that I may shew thee the word of God.\f + \fr 9.27 \ft a while: Heb. to day\f*
